tier.item: (8) Wantaim, wan man en ha wan gyal-pickni nomo Bailey (1971)
One time, one man [past] have one girl-child no-more
Note, however, that some Standard English modal forms occuring without a are filtering into the mesolect : i.e.
im cudn tek i' : S/he couldn't take it, etc.
THE ARCHITECTURE OF THE CLAUSE IN JAMAICAN CREOLE 203
`Once upon a time, there was a man who had an only daughter'
